intro: Callista trichostoma, commonly known as the silky callista, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a cluster, often surrounded by narrow, hairy leaves. Callista trichostoma is typically found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
